items.content_html:
Description

In line 22 and 26 in communication_channels, "discord" should be spelled as "Discord" because it's referring to the communication service. This fixes that.

Motivation

Same as above.

Additional details

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/MDN/Community/Communication_channels

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Correct "discord" to "Discord" in Communication Channels

Additional details

items.title: Add a more detailed explanation of boolean in glossary

items.content_html:
Description

This was the provided example, where the targetLength of 1, is less than str1.length of 2.
Therefore, this will log str1 as-is of "55".

const str1 = '55';
console.log(str1.padStart(1, '0'));  // logs '55'

However, I also tried the following and noticed that if targetLength equals str1.length, this will also log str1 as-is of "55".
For example,

const str1 = '55';
console.log(str1.padStart(2, '0'));  // logs '55'

Motivation

Clarification on the description of the targetLength parameter for the String.prototype.padStart() can help readers reduce the likelihood of introducing a bug into their codebase.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Fix description of targetLength parameter for String's padStart method

items.content_html: This PR merges SVGMatrix into DOMMatrix, going along with the BCD changes in mdn/browser-compat-data#18768. SVGMatrix doesn't exist as its own interface anymore and is an alias of DOMMatrix per the spec.
items.title: Merge SVGMatrix into DOMMatrix

items.content_html:
Hello, I am studying Speed Index right now and I came across this Glossary Definition. I thought that it could be slightly improved, with a little context about why this metric exists, and if it is appropriate to link to the two major projects using the metric in their audits.

I also think visually the image is large for the entry, so I opted to put all the text above the image with a description to further help.

Hope this proposed change resonates. I believe the information is correct at least, style wise maybe an improvement.

Description

Motivation

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Reword/restyle Glossary Definition for Speed Index

items.content_html:
This PR renames "two-value" syntax to "multi-keyword" syntax. In our content, we use "two-value" as the name, but in both BCD and the spec, it is defined as "multi-keyword".

This fixes mdn/browser-compat-data#6383 (or attempts to, at least).
Depends on mdn/css-examples#115.
items.title: CSS `display` property: "two-value syntax" -> "multi-keyword syntax"

items.content_html:
This performs some formatting of the GitHub Actions workflows to help ensure more standard-looking formatting. Additionally, this renames a few workflow jobs so they don't all have the same name.

Note: I found we have three labeler workflows (minus the rebase-needed workflow), maybe we should consolidate them?
items.title: refactor(github-actions): Format and rename workflow jobs

items.content_html:
This reverses the Prettier ignore, so that instead of ignoring all Markdown and making exceptions for folders we have performed a pass on, we only ignore the folders that are YET to be formatted. This allows us to use the .prettierignore as a breakdown list of what still needs to be performed.

This also places slashes at the beginning of each ignore statement to ensure more explicit matching of files (see https://github.com/mdn/content/pull/20674/files#r1096228284 for more context).
items.title: refactor(prettier): Reverse .prettierignore to use as breakdown list

items.content_html:
Description

  1. Corrected grammar ("a") in the first sentence changed.

Motivation

On trying to read the documentation for HTTP status 207 I found it made little sense and appeared to be written in broken English.

Additional details

n/a

items.content_html: The description of coarse and fine pointers did not provide examples, so the meaning of those terms was a bit vague and ambiguous. This change includes some concrete examples to help readers get a better sense of what an "accurate pointing device" can mean.
items.title: css/@media/pointer: give examples of coarse and fine pointers

items.content_html: Automated changes generated by scripts/update-interface-data via interface-updater github workflow
items.title: Update InterfaceData based on WebRef

items.content_html:
Bumps github/issue-labeler from 2.6 to 3.0.

Release notes

Sourced from github/issue-labeler's releases.

v3.0

What's Changed

Breaking change: Issue labels that do not match a regex will no longer be removed by default unless you set sync-labels: to 1

  • feat: add sync-labels option by @â€‹balazsorban44 in github/issue-labeler#59

Full Changelog: github/issue-labeler@v2.6...v3.0

Commits
  • cd54a96 fix for 3.0
  • be327c6 feat: add sync-labels option (#59)
  • See full diff in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting @dependabot rebase.

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
items.title: Bump github/issue-labeler from 2.6 to 3.0

items.content_html:
Description

This documents the world option in scripting.executeScript (and registerContentScripts too, in Chrome).

Motivation

This feature is not documented and I saw a request for documentation at #22493.

Additional details

Implemented in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1759932
Released in Firefox 102 with https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1766615

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #22493
I added more detail about the environment in #24215
items.title: Add docs for ExecutionWorld of scripting.executeScript API

items.content_html:
This updates ReadableStream with minimal docs for async iteration - enough to understand the API. I plan to follow this up with a more detailed example in another PR in the Using Readable streams doc.

Related docs work done in #23678
items.title: ReadableStream supports for-await-of: minimal doc

items.content_html:
Description

I added parentheses to an example where a regex expression needed to capture the matched capital letter for use in the replacement value.
For example,
The current example returns:
str.replace(/[A-Z]/g, "z$1") // 'jz$1z$1hy'

But expects:
str.replace(/([A-Z])/g, "z$1") // 'jzQzWhy'

Motivation

To fix an error in the example code execution.

Additional details

None.

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Capture match on feature detection example

items.content_html:
Description

This adds docs for the symbol-as-weakmap-keys feature. It's implemented in V8 and Safari TP. The FF bug is here: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1710433

cc @hamishwillee

Motivation

Additional details

This is pending BCD. In addition, I think we should add a note about the limited support for symbol keys at least for a few months, but I don't see a clean way to do it because it's so intertwined with the API's usage.

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: New stage 4 JS feature symbols-as-weakmap-keys
